mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Correspondence with [James] Simpson commenced in Feb. 1793 while secretary of state and must have closed at end of year when self retired from that office; correspondence will be in papers of secretary of state; remembers Simpson as consul of Morocco; mentions salary.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Simpson, James, 1781-1853
Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1818 December 31, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia] to James Riley, n.p.
